title: Booked appointments perfect
body: Today I had to give blood.  I can highley recommend the appointment service.  At my old hospital you had to take a ticket then sit and wait for ages to get 'done'. Meanwhile more and more people were coming in.   To have an appointment service is absolutely wonderful.  I did not have to wait at all.  It was in and out with courtesy and care.  The nurse I saw was so good I did not feel the needle go in and was suprised when it was all done.  I would highly recommend the practice and the nurses.  Thank you so much for a painless visit.

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Don’t bother registering here
body: It is close to impossible to get an appointment. If you can get through to talk to a receptionist who sounds like she is really not that bothered, then good luck trying to get an appointment. Tried today, no appointments in next 4 weeks. At all. She suggested I try another day in case of cancellations. No other help offered at all, just awkward silence. Fine for an appointment with a nurse or blood test etc, anything else is an absolute joke. Researching to move to another practice, hopefully with better people and system.

title: Concerning mental health support system
body: I came into the practise after finally after two and half years getting the courage to seek some real help for my mental health. Off the bat the GP whom I had an appointment with made me feel insecure and unsafe, she seemed distant and gave the impression that I was lying to her about why I’ve been feeling this way. She then proceeded to ask me “how would you kill yourself?” which for the record isn’t the best thing you should be asking someone who admits to having suicidal thoughts. I was startled by the severity of this question and fumbled around my answer so she then responded with “you haven’t seriously thought about it then”. By making me feel small and stupid in this moment meant that I didn’t focus on the rest of the conversation because I was so unexpectedly triggered. Another concern is her response to me bringing a close friend with me. I am 18 so don’t need my parents with me if i don’t want them to be with me, i opted to bring a close friend just to feel more secure. For the full appointment she kept referencing snarkily how “if i had brought my parents this would be easier to do”, leaving my friend feeling awkward and unwanted and diminishing how I feel, if someone who is suffering with mental illnesses has brought someone with them it isn’t morally correct to challenge them and tell them to tell more people even though they are visibly uncomfortable. I don’t want to return to the practise any time soon, at the risk of my mental health depleting even more.

title: Horrible service
body:
The worst NHS ,service.
Accident and emergency are supposed to be first priority. We came through an ambulance and had to wait for more than 3 hours. I do not think there are enough doctors in the hospital or in the department. Everytime you go and ask how long we have to wait to be seen by doctor the answer was “the waiting time is 6 hours and you have to be here for 6 hours then the doctors would see you”. It does not matter how serious the problem is it doesn’t mean if a person is dying then only the doctors would see them as a priority. Horrible service. The staff is rude, there is no system of anything at all. DISGUSTING.

readBy.name: The Hillingdon Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very helpful
body:
I have been registered with this practice for many years and have always found them very helpful.
I visited for a routine enquiry today and the receptionist once again went beyond my expectations in helping me access the services I needed.

title: Rude staff who lack the ability to communicate
body: Arrived at a busy A&E with an estimated 6 hour wait on the board. Explained that I had head injury, drowsiness, had been sick and was struggling to keep awake, lucky it wasn't as serious as I though as the 7+ hour wait obviously wasn't the most productive way to treat a head injury. I know that the NHS are short staffed but I am sure 1 of the 5 members of staff chatting behind the counter could have at least popped out and explained that the wait may be a little longer however I'm sure their important conversations filled with laughter was far more important that the patients you treat. I know that the NHS get unwarranted stick however the rudeness received when asking when I would likely to be seen was unwarranted and is not helping the negative view you already have. I am unsure as to why I am leaving a review as you only seem to want to reply to those that praise you rather than be honest with you. Try communicating with the patients sometimes to update them and I'm sure you're reputation would not be as tarnished as it currently is

title: Gynaecology at Jessops
body: My mum was due to visits Gynae outpatients and phoned to ask whether it would be a male or female she would be seeing as she was booked in at a male consultants clinic. She was told it was a male and my mum made it clear, should she need any scans she would not be comfortable with a male performing them. The person at the appointments line told her if this was the case she would have to wait 6 weeks and would go to the back of the queue, should she refuse to go to the appointment with a male consultant. She asked to speak to a nurse on Gynae outpatients. She spoke to a very helpful nurse and was offered a last minute appointment which she wouldn’t have been able to make due a funeral. She was then told she may or may not need the scan so should still come for the appointment. At the appointment my mum was anxious and told me to be there to advocate for her and not her let be forced into having a scan by a male doctor. She was made to feel uncomfortable when she refused to have a male to do her hysteroscopy. He was informed that my mum had phoned and what she was told. She explained she didn’t want a male however she told me he made her feel like she was inconveniencing the staff by stating she wanted a female. From the moment she refused the scan the doctor was dismissive and disinterested. My mum was well within her rights to refuse treatment from a male. To anyone going to Gynae outpatients at Jessops wing who might have a preference to a female doing their scan, I would recommend they ring up and find out who their appointment is with to avoid such an experience.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very good service
body: Friendly, courteous service from receptionists to Drs.  In nearly 30 years of attending the practice we have always been satisfied with the treatment either given or in referral. Although the practice has been much busier and appointment waiting times longer, the receptionists will try to fit patients in should the need arise.  Overall, the patients are fortunate to have this vital service.

title: centre of excellence
body:
Had a total wrist replacement and just want to say a massive thank you to all the drs and nursing staff for all the excellent care i have been given before during and after, you have gone above and beyond.
Before i had the operation the struggle was unreal.
The difference 12 months has made is amazing.
seen the surgeon again today and he is so happy with the outcome as am
i. 
So a big thank you to you all for getting me back to some normality.
it’s made such a big difference.

readBy.name: Wrightington, Wigan and Leigh NHS Trust

title: Poor health care advice
body: Attended with my 18 month old as advised by 111, waited over an hour to be seen to be given contradictory advice to 111 and the pharmacy we had visited just before. My child is still unwell and has not recovered as we were told by the clinician, who didn’t introduce the self. I can’t recommend this service as my 18 month old is still unwell. We were fobbed off with a 2 minute consultation and incorrect health care advice. The centre is not child friendly, it’s ran by Virgin health care, so privatising the NHS by making it cheaper and cutting corners. The quality of health care advice is suffering due to the inexperience of the staff this centre employee. I would have been better of using google than this centre.

title: Very Poor Service
body: I was signed off by a GP at the surgery for stress. The doctors certificate that was written was all wrong (Dates) I contacted the GP where the receptionist explained I would need to drop the certificate in with a cover note explaining the amendments. I did this on Friday. When I went into the surgery, the receptionist then said the doctor isn't in until Monday. I have had no call yesterday (Monday) so I called them this morning (Tuesday) asking if the certificate had been completed, to which I get told that it hasn't even been given to the doctor!  I have been signed off for stress, and now this has happened i now have more stress on top of me regarding my job, my wages and my rent! Utterly disgusting.

title: Stressful
body: We completed a repeat prescription form and  told that the item could be collected at our local chemist a week ago but today (and at a time when we are encouraged not to visit our GP's unless  necessary) I have been refused a repeated prescription (only the 2nd for cream) for my daughter unless we book an appointment to see the doctor. It is impossible to get an appointment in the first place, if you do, it is weeks ahead as on the day appointments are difficult to get and you have to wait at least 45 mins to see the doctor (surrounded by coughing/sneezing people) if you do get an appointment. It will also mean taking time off work and school. it really should not be this difficult.

title: All other departments have been good except the…
body: The ward are not as efficient as the other departments. You don't get your medication on time, nobody reads your notes, no control or ownership. The doctors and nurses don't communicate with each other, as a result the care for the patient is not correct. Left hours waiting for pain relief, had t go on oral antibiotics and was left on IV. Bloods should have been carried out daily and after 3 days they realised they needed to do this and woke me up at 4am to carry this out. It took them a week to realise the antiobiotics are not working, and to advise i need a blood transfusion despite saying my blood levels are very low. Alot of improvement is required on the ward's.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Lucys mother
title: No compassion
body:
I had been poorly in December and found that the compassion was withheld. I was denied treatment for being too unwell. They said they were waiting for other professionals to help them, but I believe this was an excuse because there was no other professionals involved.  
I was waiting with no help even though I was supposed to have it. Crimson Hill managers decided to halt it continuously with no promise of when they were restarting it. We were not kept informed. They did not give any indications, just would make it up. To date, the director still will not communicate to us any plans or weather she will let happen again or why. I still have not got full hours.  
They have their own rules to suit. They have no polices online or in paper form to tell you how long a complaint will take. They have not kept their promises. They stall. I am not impressed by the way they manage the company.  
It has shown a lack of compassion and understanding which I think a care company working for people with learning disabilities and mental health problems should acquire.  
I haven't been impressed with lack of communication skills. It may be due to the large quantity of staff who are leaving and starting, I realise they have problems. But even so, they should be willing to talk.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Practice can't cope
body:
Getting appointment a very hard task. When get one which takes weeks, gp over 1 hr behind. 

It clear the surgery can't cope & needs motivation from CQC. 

One of receptionists is very grumpy and replies "No appointments"! When ill and asked for emergency appointment on phone it very quick reply, "No appointments"! 

If surgery can't cope, get more gp's or close down!

title: day ruined
body: appointment was 8.40 but didnt get seen to til 8.55, i would not mind if it was a one-off but i have been seen to at least 15 mins late each and every visit for over 6 years. i asked the receptionist why and was told "i dont know im just a receptionist, ask the doctor" i asked the doctor and was told "because there is a situation with coronavirus"..... i feel insulted. considering patients with said infection do not get seen to at peterloo i find that a ridiculous EXCUSE for tardines and so disrespectful toward myself and even more those who are actually infected with coronavirus. ruined my day once again.

title: total discrage neglect and definatly not…
body: bad practice to join ring 8.30same day apps not available,nurse to call unable see doc.also reccomended time for repeat perscriptions is 72 hours before.requsted mine 3 days later went ask receptionist said still to be done ready collect after 2.explained ran out medication and need wasnt ready day after ask rude lady with glasses short hair said not signed i explain without meds day b4 n this day can she tell doc her responce i cant tel him anything made sound like i was lying about adviced collect day b4 shee said doubt told as wasnt printed till late total unprofesional left without meds  also made out wasnt adviced what id said

title: Great service and fast service
body: Since it came on line I have been using the 'Ask My G.P ' service and I have to say it is brilliant. It is so easy to use, very user friendly and I have always had a response with the hour. It has also saved me lots of time as I no longer need to hang on the phone or waste time having to see my doctor when I really do not need to. If I have a question or need to make a booking to fit around me then the ' Ask My G.P' service is just the ticket.

title: 'Great Practice'
body: I would like to say that my doctor has been fantastic. She has got great people skills. When discussing my health problems with this doctor, they are carefully listening and takes the best course of action that is required. A great Dr overall, was really impressed.

title: Coerced into leaving the waiting list
body:
My son who has been waiting over 6 months for an appointment was called out of the blue yesterday and coerced into leaving the waiting list. Totally unacceptable for a vulnerable person to be put in this position. 
If you are assessing patients this needs to be done face to face or at least through written contact. To call a vulnerable patient with no warning and to expect them to be able to understand and formulate their answers is diabolical.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: The Staff is great
body: I had a blood test this morning and the nurse was brilliant. She recognised that I have thin but deep veins and needed a butterfly needle - which worked really well! My only complaint about the surgery is that a letter was sent to me without postage and I had to pay £2.00 to get it from the sorting office. Not happy about that but mistakes can be made.

title: Shockingly poor
body: My epilepsy medication was was stopped by the practice because I was informed that I needed a medication review. Having had to wait just under two weeks for an appointment despite my medication running low on the day my appointment was cancelled due to a no show by the doctor or nurse carrying out the review. The worst part about this is the administrative team simply lie straight to your face saying messages were sent out about the cancellation when they clearly had not. Had I not arrived at the practice on the day of the appointment they probably would not have even thought or cared about booking a new appointment or has the foresight to think that medication reviews are a very serious matter for some patients. This is not the first time I’ve had these types of issues with his practice and it is simply another event in a long line of incidents. Completely unacceptable and frankly bordering on negligent.

title: Always helpful
body: Had problems with your online service. Lovely lady talked me through until we were sorted. Not very keen on new. Provider

title: Efficient, helpful and friendly practice
body:
After moving back to the area and signing on at this practice just over 2 years ago, we've found it to be at the higher end of the spectrum for making patients the real priority.
Our experience has been that when required, the GP's will spend the time to listen, advise and treat accordingly.  This is done in a respectful, attentive and compassionate way, offering appropriate advice and guidance.  
Based on a fairly recent experience, this approach went on to show its value, because the medical symptoms presented were picked up quickly and went on to prove the specific time critical elements involved required urgent hospital treatment.  We cannot thank that particular GP enough.
We've never had a problem being able to book an appointment when needed, although sometimes it does require a visit to the surgery.  Nonetheless, all the staff are friendly, approachable and will do their very best to accommodate wherever they can.

title: Understaffed pharmacy
body: After an excellent ENT appointment, I was flabbergasted to be told there was an hour wait for a prescription. This is not a one off problem. You should be able to have you prescription dispensed at any pharmacy if the wait is over 20ins or so. I am here with my elderly mother who has Alzheimer's and this is very upsetting for her

title: Great diabetic pharmacist
body: I went to have my blood test having been a diabetic for the last 8 years and finally got to see the diabetic pharmacist who gave me the correct advice on eating and my sugar dropped from 79 to 50 in 3 months which is amazing. Previously the doctor did not give any advice on what to eat and what not to eat. Therefore the introduction of the pharmacist has been terrific and would recommend anyone who has diabetes to see a diabetic pharmacist.

title: Bad phone service
body: I rang from 8am over 179 times finally get through to be pushed away they need a better phone service or a better system as when u need a appointment and don't get a chance just pushed away its not fair I thought a medical practice has a duty to care

title: 12 week stay
body:
If it was possible to leave this hospital with a score of minus 10
I would have done it gladly.
Constant arguements with Social services, Medical Staff and Therapy Team has left us caring for 16 hours a day 7 Days a week
Lack of information etc etc 
I am of the opinion that if I get to my eighties I might as well commit suicide (And I am against Suicide) that will bring me a better quality of life than this Hospital portrays to give

readBy.name: Southport and Ormskirk Hospital NHS Trust

title: Fantastic staff and brilliant care
body: Thank you NGH. I arrived at A&E at 4am on Monday and was seen within 5 minutes of arrival. By 6am they had diagnosed me and started treatment. I was admitted and have been totally looked after by all areas and departments I have visited. The staff at the Nurses Station were kind and considerate considering the pressures of finding beds for people. The staff on A&E were prompt and compassionate. The staff on the Hawthorn Ward were also fantastic, personable and incredibly caring. The consultants and doctors from ENT were also great. I think you run an amazing service and all of the team from cleaners to Consultants that I have had contact with during my visit have been nothing but faultless. Thank you.

title: Long wait for results.
body:
I think its a disgrace when cancer patients have still not recieved cancer results after over 2 weeks .Now nearly 3 weeks !
It states on letter results will be given within 2 weeks.
I have left 3 telephone messages for someone regarding this to contact me and up to now still no letter or phone call regarding my results..
I understand i am not the only patient waiting on results but after already having had cancer once hopefully you will understand my anger.
Thankyou.

readBy.name: Countess of Chester Hospital NHS Foundation Trust.

author: Pizzaman
title: Live donor services
body: I recently was tested to see if I could give my brother my kidney. Claire booked me in the next day, went thru the whole thing with me then took my blood herself I was really happy with the service. She put me at ease and answered everything very clearly in a way I understood. She rang me the same day with my results and I was shocked at how easy it all is. She is very good at her job. I will recommend highly.

title: Appalling service
body:
If you manage to reach the practice by phone, calls are handled poorly. I've been promised calls back from doctors and nurses that never materialise, and no record of notes or actions from reception staff on my file to follow up. Reception staff are unhelpful and rude.

GP appointments are running late and rushed. 

I've never seen the same doctor twice.

Test results from hospital referrals are not followed up by GP practice.

I would thoroughly recommend you look elsewhere to register.

author: Senior nurse
title: Visit to urgent care centre
body: My 3 year old granddaughter had been unwell for 3 days, saw G P yesterday, tonsillitis, given penicillin, unable to eat due to very sore tongue, 111 made appointment for 5 40, seen at 6 10 by a nurse. I am sad to say the examination left a lot to be desired, the nurse did not depress her tongue to check her throat, did not check her ears, did not check her glands, did not listen to her chest, all these are routine when examining a child. I have been a nurse for more than 50 years and I am truly concerned if that is the level of care that is given, we were concerned it may be scarlet fever, however I felt this nurse was very sharp when this was suggested, I am fully aware that the treatment is the same as she is taking, but it does need to be notified, her cheeks were very red and rough but alas this went unnoticed. I hope that this is read and acted upon, needless to say my daughter wears very unhappy with the consultation as was I.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Professional Service
body: Having been referred by my local opticians I attended for preliminary eye assessment and subsequently cataract surgery.  On each occasion I received a friendly welcome, with a professional and efficient approach being taken by all levels of staff, from arrival to discharge.  Each level of procedure and after-care was clearly explained and any questions easily answered.  Waiting time was minimal, the wait for the anesthetic to work being longer than the surgery itself which, as I was assured, was painless. I would have no hesitation in using again or recommending to others.

author: greenfj87
title: Full hysterectomy, left in pain
body:
I had a full hysterectomy Feb 2020.  
The night time care was very poor by the nurses. I was left for 9 hours in pain, I kept asking for the Dr and help for the pain but no one came, they stayed in their nurses station. There are lots of bank staff at night but they either didn't know what to do or hated their job.  
The way 2 senior staff members spoke to me was disgusting that I went home the next day (they were not bank staff). I had nightmares when I came home. I have never felt so vulnerable in my life. I am just so thankful that I had a great gynecologist, the thought of having to go back there terrifies me.  
So if these reviews do get read from the powers above, please sort that department out for all the other vulnerable ladies going in there.

title: Excellent care
body:
I had my second hip replacement at Charing Cross on 28 Feb
Once again I cannot praise the staff highly enough for the fantastic care I received.
From admissions to theatre and then to Ward 7 South every member of staff treated me with so much kindness and I felt at ease the whole time.
The staff on ward 7 South were so attentive and caring and although extremely busy made sure myself and the other patients were comfortable and well looked after at all times.
You are a credit to the NHS.
A big thank you to everyone.

title: i feel irrelevant
body:
The reception staff are, at best, adequate, it has taken well over three weeks for me to get a professional form back. 
They NEVER ring my mobile and leave a message, as they claim they do. White lies are so unprofessional. Yes it is the correct number and i do receive messages from other parties. 
This form that i have paid 25 pounds to get signed, (which is well over what i paid within the last two years.) over three weeks ago, and the doctor hadn't even read the form correctly and ticked the wrong box, this could have easily have stopped me gaining employment! I will be moving GP's due to this. UNACCEPTABLE. The staff didn't even apologise.

title: Great visit
body: I was very impressed with the professional way I was treated at a recent  visit to this doctors practice.

author: Sham0082
title: Renal staff got me through tough times
body: I started dialysis in August 2018 just 3 weeks after weight loss surgery (was 254kg) and throughout the last 19 months I had lots of ups and downs due to the rapid weight loss and dialysis sometimes leaving me very down and severely depressed it was a challenge to even get my needles in as I was so big and fistula was hard to reach, and sometimes had to make do with 1 needle instead of the 2 through a lot of help and getting me to QEUH I got my fistula fixed a year ago and have never looked back. all the staff every day I was in were so helpful and would always brighten up my day and kept me going. I am now down to 102kg and have a new perspective on life and I would like to thank the nurses at the forth valley renal clinic for the help over the last 19 months.

author: Claymoar
title: SHSC Gender Identity Service
body:
I was referred by my GP to the gender clinic about three years ago. I was told there would be a wait of around 14 months for my first assessment, and then 3-4 months for my final assessment.  
14 months later I had my first assessment, whereupon I was advised to contact iapt. I contacted iapt and they said I wasn't allowed to have focused therapy because I was still on the waiting list at the GIC, but they did help with some basic anxiety counselling.  
The GIC effectively ghosted me for 18 months. They wouldn't answer my emails and when I called they either asked me to email or told me they didn't have any answers for me.  
Eventually, after calling once every 4-6 months for a year and a half, (a time frame which was estimated at 3-6 months) they booked my final assessment.  
At my final assessment I was told I would have a letter of confirmation within a week or so and then a detailed summary about a month later.  
After a month and a half I called the service and was told the letter was still awaiting confirmation. A week or so later I was sent two appointment invites. Neither stated the reason for the appointment. I still had not received any confirmation/diagnosis.  
As it turned out the first appointment was to discuss hormone therapy, and I there asked the clinician to give me a copy of these letters I hadn't received.  
Almost a month after the hormone appointment, I got a copy of a letter sent to my GP saying I could start treatment and another appointment at the GIC. I also made an appointment to see my GP, a week after the GIC appointment was scheduled.  
I arrived at the GIC, in the middle of the afternoon,. At short notice, on a work day, to find that my appointment had been double booked and I had to wait an extra 45 minutes anyway.  
When I eventually got seen, I was told that this appointment was a 4 month review for the medication I was due to start a week from now, and that I didn't need to be here.  
When I went to my GP, they went over the letter the clinic sent, and found that the medication they had recommended no longer existed. Luckily the GP had experience with prescribing trans patients and knew what to switch me to.  
So to sum up, my experience with Sheffield's gender clinic has been that I feel my time & their time has been wasted for three full years on what essentially could've been a counselling session and a consultation with an endocrinologist. There was absolutely no reason whatsoever for this to go on for the length of time that it did, or for there to be so many steps involved, especially when, after all that anxiety and waiting and stress, their advice was useless and my GP had to take matters into her own hands anyway.  
But what do I know? I'm not a medical professional.

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Plymouth University Health and Human Sciences students, 2018

title: Wonderful care and support
body: I received counselling over the course of 5 months. My therapist was brilliant and really supported me through a challenging time. She helped me to understand why we behave in certain ways and this helped me to make sense of things and process them. Being heard and understood is so important. The counselling came just when I needed it the most and I would absolutely recommend it to anyone and everyone! Many thanks again.

title: Good efficient service
body: Rang the surgery on Thursday afternoon as was feeling breathless and had a previous DVT. Was offered an appointment at 16.50 with a doctor.  Very good service  from the reception staff . The doctor advised me to go for a blood test on Friday morning and he would ring me later with the results. He rang me at 6.30 pm to advise me to attend urgent care which I did later.   I was admitted to the ward later that evening. Thank you for the exceptional service offered.

title: Lovely friendly staff
body: I am fairly new to this Surgery and so far I am really pleased. I was a bit worried having seen the other review, but I have been able to see a doctor on one of the daily walk in surgeries if I dont want to wait for a booked appointment.  Receptionists and office staff have been very polite, respecful and helpful.  Doctors are pleasant and dont make you feel like you have wasted their time.  Would definately recommend this surgery,

title: Busy but good
body: Although the surgery like so many others has become much busier over the years it still remains excellent. There is a walk in surgery every morning and expect a wait but you will be seen. Booked appointments with your own GP will take much longer but they are doing their best. All the staff are friendly and helpful.

title: Been there for 20 years
body: Great surgery great staff and great treatment However reception staff can occasionally be terse

title: Professional, caring  and respectful practice
body: Our household has been very well served by all the staff at this excellent surgery. It is with regret that we are moving and we are hard-pressed to find another practice where you can see a doctor the next day - albeit, you have to wait your turn - but this is a small inconvenience. Over the years, the surgery has seemed more busy but our  experience is of efficiency , care and dignity. We thank all the staff who have provided us with an excellent and reassuring service.

title: Worse practice in century
body:
3 months prescription waiting 
Five times going back and fourth
They lost my repeat prescription
Two visits to hospital to tell them to the prescription again
Ran out of medicine and they don't give me medicine
Doctor never available for writing or printing or even telling us why the prescription is missing 
And they don't want princely prescription until evening when they will lose the prescription again. 

Sitting here in the waiting room for hours for medication

title: Professional, caring  and respectful practice
body: Our household has been very well served by all the staff at this excellent surgery. It is with regret that we are moving and we are hard-pressed to find another practice where you can see a doctor the next day - albeit, you have to wait your turn - but this is a small inconvenience. Over the years, the surgery has seemed more busy but our  experience is of efficiency , care and dignity. We thank all the staff who have provided us with an excellent and reassuring service.

title: Well looked after as a temporary registered…
body:
Following an out of hospital VF arrest I was looked after as a temporary riegistered  patient an this surgery

I found the service excellent, very professional, reception staff efficient and polite. I was able to discuss openly with the GP my situation and reicieved excellent advice and support.

I needed my medication for hypertension modified weekly and benefited greatly from being able to attend ‘walk in surgery’ week days.

title: The best surgery I have ever had
body: I have been at this surgery for about 20 years and found every body very helpful, in times of trouble for me the doctors and its the  staff always go out of there way to help. I cannot under stand some of the comments on here about the reception staff being rude etc, they are always good its the way some people talk to them I find rude and aggresive  its the old adage you reap what you sow some of the patients old and young are so impatient, this  causes stress all round. How would you react first thing in the morning if a person came to moaning and groaning, the staff need the patience of a saint  at 08.15 in the morning. As for having to wait  over an hour to see a  doctor  what do you expect from a very busy surgery they are not miracle workers and the doctors always give the time to listen to a patients problems  You would be moaning about that if they didnt.  As for other problems such as prescriptions with the many thousands of patients on the  lists any where you go minor gliches are bound to happen just afford   the staff and doctors the curtesy they afford you. Thankyou  I confirm this is a totally unbiased opinion of a grateful  patient

title: Terrible practice.
body: All services are incredibly slow. Doctors barely come out of their rooms to call names of patients so many are missed. The receptionists feel the need to shout everything they say although the waiting room is obviously full of sick people. The whole surgery is shambles.

author: hydrusew86
title: Poor care our Mum received
body:
My mum was admitted to hospital in January this year. She’d felt unwell with vomiting & diarrhoea for a month but didn’t attend her surgery as getting an appointment is very difficult. She eventually did see the practice nurse who took bloods & contacted her that same afternoon.....her egfr was dangerously low (10) & she was instructed to go to hospital immediately.  
She was advised to go to the Combined Assessment Unit rather that A&E. The unit was very busy & there were no beds for her. She was cannulated & left on a trolley until she was reviewed at around 6 in the morning (she’d gone in at 7pm the previous night) Surely with her egfr so low, & being advised to go ‘straight to hospital’ by the practice nurse, she required fluids immediately.......not 11 hours after going in?  
She was given a single room in CAU and advised she would be transferred to the renal unit when a bed became available. My sister & I attended with our dad the next day. My mum looked really poorly, & the catheter she had in was draining very little amounts. It was clear the ward was busy .....most people we tried to ask about mums plan of care replied with she’s not my patient.  
That night my mum phoned my sister, distressed as no one would answer her buzzer, her cot side had been put up & she couldn’t get to the toilet. She already found it difficult to hold the catheter bag & manoeuvre the drip stand to get to the toilet, without the added barrier of a cot side. She was distressed at this point.....she was still having frequent episodes of diarrhoea & earlier that day hadn’t managed to reach the toilet in time. My sister phoned the ward explaining she needed help. The nurse (a bank nurse we later discovered) then went into my mums room & scolded her, telling her that she didn't need to go to the toilet as she had a catheter in, then pushed my mums torso back on to the bed. Was she completely clueless as to why my mum was there?  
My mum felt frightened of this nurse after this encounter. After mum said she needed to open her bowels, the nurse finally put the cot side down & let her use the toilet. My sister & I visited the next day, mum was upset, telling us that after my sister had phoned, a nurse or auxiliary (she couldn’t be sure who) went into her room & angrily asked her did you phone your family?! We’ve got very sick people to look after in here! We’ll answer the buzzer when we can, don’t bother your family again.  
How dare anyone tell my mum not to contact us!  
The next day my sister, my dad & I arrived at 2pm. Mums toilet was filthy, & had 4 bed pans containing diarrhoea in them (she was on fluid balance & it was to be measured). She was sitting in a chair & we could see the bed sheets were slightly soiled. My sister asked if the toilet could be cleaned & the bed changed, which they duly were. We were grateful to the cleaners & the nurse who changed the bed. We asked all 3 if they could do something about the bed pans in the bathroom, they all said they’d tell mums own nurse.  
2 hours later i asked a nurse at the desk if the bed pans could be removed, she looked up from note writing & said I don’t work here. I was astonished at how unhelpful people were. I understand everyone is very busy, but I felt that was just rude.  
Everyone we’d asked that day to explain what the plan was for mum (& was she going to renal as was discussed previously) said sorry I’m not your mums nurse. The occasional helpful one said I’ll try to find her. We didn’t actually see mums nurse the entire day.  
We resorted to desperate measures, asking the staff member who brought in dinner if they could try & find someone to remove the bed pans. This staff member said they would try to find someone to do it, but as with all the other times, no one came. In the 3 hours we’d been there, we’d helped mum up to the toilet at least 8 times. Not wanting to fill the entire toilet floor with bed pans of diarrhoea, she’d just gone in the actual toilet. A lot of fluid not measured.  
My sister went to the desk when she saw a doctor. Again, the doctor wasn’t my mums doctor, but this doctor helpfully brought in mums notes & discussed her care plan with us. We were so grateful to them for filling us in. We also asked this doctor if they could help us identify mums nurse to get rid of the bed pans (6th person we’ve now asked) & explained how upset we were that they’d been in there all day & mums output was being correctly measured. The doctor said they would get the charge nurse to speak to us.  
About an hour later, a senior member of staff came in the room, arms folded appearing ready for battle. Their opening to my sister & I was Hi, I hear you have some complaints. Who are you.  
I ask who they were, which seemed to displease this staff member & this set the tone for the discussion. I felt it was completely rude and unprofessional to not introduce themselves to us. My sister & I are both health professionals, I’m certain one of the first things I learnt was to introduce yourself and explain your position at the earliest opportunity.  
We explained our concerns.....mainly the way my mum was treated by the staff on her first night in the unit & the failure of her nurse that day to monitor her output. This staff member was defensive during the whole conversation and informed us they had no real control over bank nurses, and that our mum's nurse today has been very busy with an extremely sick patients. This staff member then brought out a notepad & said, i see you’ve also complained about the bed not being changed & the toilet not being cleaned., and informed us our mums nurse offered to change the bed in the morning & that our mum declined. And that the toilets are cleaned on a back shift, not before. We felt this senior staff member was trying to insinuate we had a long list of complaints & it felt like they liked those ones because they had answers for us.  
I informed this staff member again that we absolutely weren’t complaining about those things, we asked for the toilet to be cleaned & the bed to be changed which they were, timeously. We received no response regarding the bed pans left in the toilet all day other than the nurse was busy with another very sick patient. What about my mum?? Wasn’t she sick enough to warrant minimum standard of care for her condition......fluid balance?? My sister & I were astounded that we were not once offered concern or an apology, especially for the way my mum was spoken to after phoning her family for help as she didn’t know what else to do.  
My mum never did get transferred to renal. There was never a bed available. She stayed on CAU for 6 days. I’m pleased to say that after the first 3 day’s the care improved & she was shown kindness from many nurses. Nevertheless, what sticks in our minds is the appalling treatment from night shift staff on her 2nd night & the indifference shown by the senior staff member when we raised our concerns.

title: Discharged home with no medication
body:
My father was admitted to ward 14e with a severe chest infection and was generally very poorly with no appetite, confusion and poor mobility. These symptoms came on very quickly and it was shocking to see him in such a deteriorated condition. After around 12 days, with not much evidence of any action being taken and conflicting stories from the dr, he was discharged despite my protestations that he was still very poorly. He was given no medication even though his chest and cough still seemed very bad.  
He had no care support even though I pleaded for some help. He lasted at home for a week before ending up back on the ward. This time more tests were done but I still felt I wasn't really taken seriously when I asked about his physical condition and expressed the opinion that he wasn't fit to come home.  
Again he was given no antibiotics on discharge despite obviously still suffering from pneumonia. He was provided with a carer package this time but the day after he was discharged the carer arrived an hour and a half too early and he fell on his way to the door to let them in.  
He ended up back in a& e less than 24hrs after his second discharge where, when I tried to ask a doctor how we could ensure he received the proper care this time, I was faced with condescension and plain rudeness. At a difficult time with an extremely poorly father this was the final straw and was so unprofessional it was unbelievable.  
Throughout the whole process I have felt undervalued, not listened to or taken seriously. Despite knowing the most about my father and willingly offering this information drs seemed to have made up their minds that he had dementia and did not take his physical wellbeing into enough consideration. I felt the care he received was negligent and have caused untold pain and suffering.

readBy.name: Plymouth University Urgent and Emergency Care Bsc (2020)

title: Inadequate booking system
body:
i totally agree with other comments made. AW has some really good
Dr's but the booking system REALLY needs to be reviewed . Why is nothing done when ALL the comments are saying the same thing ??
there is simply NO way you can get to see a Dr and when you eventually do manage to see someone the surgery is more or less empty

author: AMills
title: Thanks for kindness & patience
body: I had a gynecological appointment with Mr Oteri at United Lincolnshire Hospitals NHS Trust at the beginning of March 2020. I was quite anxious and nervous about this appointment having had several bad experiences at other hospitals many years ago. Mr Oteri was very kind and listened to what I had to tell him about my previous experiences and why I was anxious. He was extremely gentle in my examination and could not have been nicer. He explained everything to me and what would happen next and answered my questions. He was very reassuring and I would like to say thank you to him for his kindness and patience.

title: Brilliant Doctor  and receptionist
body: I had to go in for a minor procedure today and the staff were so supportive and understand. They helped to keep me calm. The Dr was so understanding when I changed my mind and gave me an alternative straight away.

title: Great Physio's
body: I started the Physiotherapy sessions after rupturing my achillies. i was assisted throughout my time in the lower limb group mainly by 2 physios who i found to be of great help. I was given exercises which greatly helped my mobility and reduce the pain i felt while walking. They were friendly and understanding of any problems i was going through whilst going through my recovery phase.

author: Jossboss
title: My mental health history being disclosed in referral
body:
In December 2019 I started to experience generalised joint pain, swelling and deterioration in function and mobility in all my joints. I have a family history of Rheumatoid Arthritis and associated auto immune diseases so felt I better get it checked out.  
My GP ran blood tests, one of which suggested an issue with the Lupus antibody. I was therefore referred to the Rheumatology Clinic in Stonehouse Hospital mid February 2020. I also have a history of depression and low mood and chronic pain following a spinal injury. I have been under the care of Psychiatry, the Community Mental Health Team and a CPN for a few years.  
I arrived for the Rheumatology appointment and was greeted by a member of staff who stated, I understand that you are under the care of the Community Mental Health Team and Psychiatry.  
I felt absolutely humiliated!  
The disclosure on the letter of referral about my mental health history had absolutely no relevance to what I was attending for yet it absolutely dictated how I was treated. The felt I had been labelled before I even sat down. The staff member discharged me from the clinic and as I was leaving they told me I could pick up leaflets on Fibromyalgia and Raynaulds Syndrome on my way out.  
I understand about full disclosure and the importance of providing accurate patient history in a letter of referral, but by putting my mental health history front and centre of this letter it completely prejudiced the way I was treated. I have now asked for a second opinion and am awaiting a response.  
The experience left me feeling humiliated and betrayed. Yes, I am the first one to admit I suffer from depression, but when I present with physical symptoms and a family history I expect to be treated on an even playing field. I had hoped that discrimination of this type was a thing of the past in the 21st century, sadly not!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration
South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

title: Its a funny old place but useless staff
body: Another time recently I went to collect a missing prescription. It was for two lots of tablets. When I was given 2 prescriptions I looked at what they were for. One prescription had the two lots of tablets on. And the other had one tablet on but that one tablet was already on the prescription that had two tablets on. You had given. Me the same prescription twice. I pointerd that out and you just scrapped the duplicate one

title: Kind staff
body: Compared to Coventry I find the staff at George Elliott really kind and caring. The modern check in is much better and both doctors and nurses have always been patient and understanding to me.

title: Blood clinic
body:
I have regular blood tests at this department because I am a  haematology patient.  I have never understood why patients on  chemotherapy and therefore very susceptible to infection, have to wait amongst a large numbers of people to get their bloods done.
It also doesn't instil confidence coz the department looks dirty, and with ripped seats. I am always on edge when I go there.

author: Lollgould
title: Being unable to give feedback via text
body:
Both my husband and my father have recently received outstanding treatment at high Wycombe hospital and the Churchill hospital in Oxford.  
Having attempted to reply many times to offer feedback for the outstanding care I am furious that I can’t respond.  
I now understand it is because my Virgin media phone provider doesn’t allow us to respond to the NHS 808 70 number. ( and other short numbers).  
Therefore feedback good or bad from virgin customers won’t get through to these hospitals. Appears to have been a problem since 2018.

author: Fredd
title: Upper gi & colonoscopy
body:
I would like to take the time to thank the staff at Good Hope hospital Treatment Centre.  
Their kindness, professionalism & experience was awesome.  
In particular, I would like to thank Dr Zahir & nurses Natalie & Angela.  
Also all the others on duty that sunday 8th March.  
Well done guys 👍

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: A recent attendance at Day Surgery
body: I attended for removal of a bcc recently and was overwhelmed by the professionalism and kindness shown towards myself and my daughter by Pamela and Jennifer. They made me feel reassured and relaxed throughout the whole experience. Thank you.

readBy.name: Office of Angus MacDonald, MSP for Falkirk East

author: Phoenix2qt
title: Structured Clinical Managment
body:
After years of wrongful meds, misdiagnosis and appalling care under a previous team, I moved home to Scotland, was diagnosed with EUPD and experienced amazing care from the team at Howgill. Glynis, Stephen and Jeannie are amazing people, who do a fantastic job. I credit them with helping me come back from a horrific low period!  
After a period of support and treatment I was put forward for SCM.  
SCM has been an amazing experience so far. Emma, Stephen and Kath have been great, creating a relaxed, supportive, educational environment to help learn these skills to self manage this tricky diagnosis. They each have a different teaching style and bring different perspectives, which really helps when you find the modules as challenging as I do. No question is too daft, no subject is off limits, there is no judgment. Group is a safe space.Emma as a cpn has been great, helping me decipher my emotions, encouraging me to PROBLEM SOLVE and is good at getting me to manage myself, but is still there if I need support. I initially felt a bit abandoned after the intense support of my previous cpn after a family member died, but I feel Emma is helping me (as is group) to take command of my EUPD and learn to manage it myself, rather than hiding or becoming its victim. Although she has not been tested (by my pet who met all the other cpns) I can tell she’s AWESOME.  
Stephen and Kath are also fab, they’re great at helping untangle the woolly mass of randomness that is my brain with EUPD, and all together I can’t imagine any team more perfect to teach this group.  
But enough about those amazing people, don’t want their heads to get too big lol!  
Group is great. I’ve met so many people and we’ve become friends. It’s fab not feeling so isolated and alone.  
The material is explained well, although I do take issue with the handouts. There’s so much paperwork. I think it could be streamlined so that instead of getting sheets each week, and then duplicates when we recover the subjects, maybe creating a workbook would help cut down on all that?  
The room we meet in is pretty crap. The facilitators make the best of it, but other people barge in, or barge past noisily. There was building work going on, so lots of noise and people clomping past on scaffolding. The tables are moved, removed, our board goes missing, at one point we didn’t have a room as they had double booked us and given the room to someone else.... in normal circumstances this is annoying but when you’re dealing with sensitive issues it becomes a huge issue. It impacts on the safe space of the group and is a big distraction.  
The group focusing on self management rather than being a support group is great. It means the environment is much more positive, and it actually makes me hopeful for my future. I like the little mindfulness minute thing we do at the beginning as it opens up your mind to other coping strategies that you might not usually consider.  
So in short SGM and the CMHT are fab, and worth their weight in gold.  
The one thing I do miss and struggle with is my art. I’d love to have some sort of art therapy available in this area, as it’s something I believe would really help with this and other mental health diagnosis’s.

title: Lay in hospital bed writing this
body:
Rushed in in considerable pain.
Staff do a good job but dont ask in depth questions coz answers are vague.
Simple question so why the chest pain answers so far, could be heart attack, corona virus, lung &/or chest infection, flu virus. Let's see what tomorrow brings.
Got moved around from room to room now unsure where I am or why. Food, gave up after first bite of a unasked for sandwich. (Still losing a bit of weight wont hurt) first cell clean floor, grey walls, very noisy plumbing, no tv or pictures to stare at, noisy giggling staff out side room, my room has access door to a continually used store room housing what looks like rubbish bins, no windows. Just one very dim spotlight. Later Moved to second cell along with all test equipment, 
oxygen bottle, my clothes holder and drip laying on my chest. all squeezed on bed thats too small for me (I'm 5ft 10ins) dumped in second cell & left, over hour & half maybe two before nurse arrived & asked what's wrong with me as no hand over done, ( still at least bits removed from bed, great a bit more room, & drip of ? Hung up). Second cell has no tv just hanging cables for show as tv broke so was removed I'm told, a very wonky sign on toilet door, toilet used as a cupboard stacked with chairs in shower area, windows that are broken & cant be closed, ask a couple of times for extra blankets but so far (a day later) still not arrived  luckily I had a fleece jacket & dressing gown to cover me..I was asked if I wanted tea it arrived but dumped far out of reach along with jug of water. Friend told to take my daily prescribed dosset box meds & morphine bottle home as they cant use them (health & safety excuse used) then later when given same medication by nurse one tablet was missing I asked why & was told we haven't got it in stock, we had to order some. Opps
Live- just had nurse in 2nd time to test my blood sugar levels good news reads same as first test, she asked if I was diabetic? No I'm not was my reply, oh she said well your notes say you are. This has made me decide I think it might be best to leg it.
But as its too early to call friends to help me escape so I'll have hang on still it'll be nice to see how this comedy of errors plays out. All this written while laying on my cold cell and small worn out hospital bed. Hey Ho :/.  Still staff are friendly and chatty. Have a nice stay

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Very good care received
body: I had a very good experience at the kent&Canterbury hospital from the moment I arrived & was given prompt medical treatment & diagnoses I was admitted to the Clark ward the hospital was very clean when I stayed all the nurses & doctors where very attentive during my stay & I received very good care the food was also very nice

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent service
body:
I was concerned about one of my eyes. On arrival I was treated with great care by 3 nurses who carried out tests. I then saw the ophthalmologist who thoroughly examined my eyes, assured me that there was nothing seriously wrong and prescribed dry eye drops.
I arrived at 1330 for a 1400 appointment. I was discharged at 1415. 
An outstanding service. Thank you

author: BabyIby
title: Infant feeding team breastfeeding support
body:
I wanted to say a massive thank you to the fantastic team at wishaw general hopsital infant breastfeeding support team! Anne marie corrected my sons tongue tie within seconds! It was painless and quick and we were advised of absolutely everything at each stage! Im so grateful for the immense support, encouragement and advice! I have had Laura coming out to the house to show me how to breastfeed successfully!  
A special thanks to Laura for visiting me on three ocassions and also Ann Marie for correcting my sons tongie tie at 5 weeks and Maureen for being my phone a friend breast feeding advisor! Thank you to all the other ladies including Lesley, Michelle, Sharon, Leigh-Anne, Anne and all the rest. If it wasnt for your team i wouldnt be still breastfeeding my 2 month old boy now! Many thanks

title: Continued support
body: I have recently been going for test and have felt nervous and also awaiting further treatment for my health issues I have had the continued support with any concerns I might have about them by the doctor I am currently seeing in helping me see the bigger picture

author: SRoss
title: Infant Feeding Support Worker
body:
My baby was born prematurely at Raigmore Hospital, Inverness. And, we were in SCBU for 6 weeks. During this time, I had help from an Infant Feeding Support Worker (Cathy) with Breastfeeding. I wanted to say how invaluable that was. Breastfeeding is an aspect that is very important and was something I was determined to be able to do. Having Cathy there was extremely helpful, and supportive. Although all the nurses in SCBU are fantastic, and can be asked anything, they have so much else to do/keep an eye on, that they simply don't always have the time to spend with you to help for an entire Breastfeed. It's something that requires time and patience, so having Cathy there to spend that important time was, as I say, invaluable.  
Not only did she have the time, but as this was her main role, I felt comforted knowing how experienced she was in this aspect. She came across as highly experienced, which was reassuring. It was helpful having a main person to discuss it with rather than input and advice from multiple different people/sources.  
Having a premature baby is stressful enough and without having the hands on help and support, I'm not sure how well I would have got on attempting the feeding alone.

title: Professional and kind
body: Treated with dignity and respect by the healthcare practitioners and HCA's. Felt comfortable in their presence and answered my questions and concerns.

title: Excellent support
body: I would like to thank the Cardiac Rehab team for their excellent support following my out-of-hospital cardiac arrest. All members of the team were professional, supportive and compassionate. Nothing was too much trouble for them. I very much appreciated their proactive approach to contacting me at home, initial home visits, rehab exercise classes, and talks on, for example, mental health aspects of heart attacks and how to do CPR.

title: Greatservice
body: I was seen by a brilliant clinical pharmacist about high blood pressure medication.    I thought this was a wonderful service and with a very efficient professional and friendly and approachable pharmacist.  This person put me at ease and I was relaxed when I had my blood pressure checked.   I will hope to continue seeing this person.  5 stars

title: Excellent local GP surgery
body:
Whenever I need to see a GP, I always get an appointment, I have not to this day been refused one.
The doctors and nurses on site are friendly, professional, and understand your medical concerns on a personal level, which is rare.
The surgery has very good connections with all the local health providers, including Barbara Castle Way health Centre, and Royal Blackburn Hospital.
This GP surgery provides exactly the kind of doctors our area needs.
Excellent and efficient service as usual. Thank you.

title: Excellent Service
body: TLC have supported my mum at home for over a year now and have provided ongoing excellent support and care.  Staff are reliable friendly and caring.  The support has also extended to myself and my brother.  Without the care and compassion shown to us we would have struggled to cope with the help our mum needed at home. I can not recommend this service highly enough.  Thank you for all the care you have given us all, particularly our mum.  Your support at a terrible time for us all will never be forgotten.

title: Fantastic  Service from a great practice
body: I have recently had a bout of illness. From seeing the GP for the first time, to diagnosis, to then treatment and aftercare, I have received five star treatment from beginning to end. In particular, the reception staff were very kind and helpful at all times, can’t thank them enough for their kindness during a difficult time.

title: UNSUNG HEROES  -  THE PORTERS
body:
A very big thank you to the porters who assisted me the first week of March from front reception to Gt. Tey Ward. They were very kind, courteous and cheerful and nothing was too much bother.   I have mobility problems and the help they provided was very much appreciated.
Thank you very much.  I  am sure you know who you are .

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Surgery deteriorated beyond belief
body:
I cannot walk into reception and book an appointment!!!! Honestly, I'm not lying! What I have to do when I'm ill and need to see a doctor, is to ring the surgery, then I have to wait around for a doctor to call me, and then an appointment can be made. If this wasn't bad enough, the reception staff don't have a clue about manners and seem to forget that they are working to serve us. I'm born in sawbridgeworth and have lived here all my life, so this is the only surgery I have ever dealt with. It has gone down hill and if I had a choice I would go elsewhere but there isn't anywhere else to go .........
What on earth is going on at Central Surgery?

title: End of life care A&E Wexham Park
body:
Would just like to say something in support of our NHS. 
This evening we had the sad experience of losing someone close to us in Wexham A&E.
Despite the current strain on the service, we were without exception, treated with respect, compassion and outstanding professionalism. As  ex NHS staff myself I understand how difficult it is to present a consistent and sympathetic front under such strain. From housekeeper to senior Consultant we were treated with empathy , love, and respect, nothing was too much trouble  nor patience tested when faced with a confused ,scared elderly dementia gripped  loved one. 
Iam bursting with pride for our NHS tonight.
Please treat it with the care and respect it deserves, so that in your unfortunately time of need it will treat you the same as it has us tonight. 😥

title: Appoinments
body:
I’ve just called to book an appointment, and apparently was the 1st one in the queue.. After waiting 15 mins, the phone rang couple of times, and someone decided to put it down!! If it was my lunchtime I would have lost 1/4 of my lunchtime for nothing! Every time I try to book an appointment, there is ALWAYS an issue! I’ve had enough of this incompetence! Unfortunately this is the closest to where I live, so have had to go to this one although I complain every single time!!
You just need to hire another person to help booking the appointments! I was told yesterday that new booking slots would be available today after 3pm (that’s why they couldn’t book it when I visited surgery yesterday). And now I waisted more than 15 mins of my life-AGAIN!!
My suggestion to new patients is that don’t bother registering at this surgery; go and find another one in the area/ they can’t be worse, can they?

title: Ladies excersise
body: I am very happy with the physiotherapy I recieve. Staff is brilliant and helpful. Really helped me. I find going to the class has helped me physically. The exercise is good.

title: So much care and professionalism
body:
My ex-husband was sent to Emergency on Feb. 9th.
I came from France where I live and was very impressed by all staff and doctors.
He was very unwell and I was allowed to stay with him during the night (12 to 13th/02).
I have been very moved by all nurses and doctors who were so efficient and kind.
THANK YOU VERY MUCH.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Reception team un-helpful
body: Medication mix up, I needed it resolved so that I didn’t experience withdrawal side effects but the receptionist was not willing to go out of her way to ensure the mix up was resolved quickly. It’s like trying to get through a front line in a war zone.

title: To be commended
body:
I am classed as a ‘chronically’ ill patient.
Yesterday morning I phoned the surgery to request a GP call back.
The pleasant receptionist asked if a call back was sufficient.
Within 20 mins a GP called me.
He was polite, thorough, did not hurry me, listened and we discussed treatment options. He was receptive to my opinions.
We reached a mutually acceptable plan.
For me, it is very important to be allowed to be involved with my treatments. It’s my disease.
The whole process was stress free and efficient.
I would like to compliment the team at the Aspen centre for being proactive and patient focussed.
Excellent service....and thank you.

title: The NHS as it should be
body: First rate facility with a great team.  Consultation, scan, tests, results and diagnosis all within 3 hours.  And a free cup of tea for good measure! The right balance of friendliness and professionalism

title: Lovely doctors
body: Was seen very promptly - same day due to my health condition. Dealt with in a timely fashion, GP was very thorough and told me what to do if symptoms remain following medication. Also GP had a lovely manner.

title: Caring, considerate, engaged and supportive
body: I spent 9 months being treated for the effects of PTSD arising from my service during Op TELIC.  My care with IAPT was professional and focused from my initial assessment to the end of my treatment.  I was seen promptly, within 2 weeks of my initial referral, and after starting CBT my counsellor quickly identified that my issues probably arose from my military service; I was quickly and efficiently referred for a formal diagnosis of PTSD and accepted onto a course of EMDR.  Despite the challenges of EMDR and the requirement to focus on and review some extremely distressing memories, the staff treating me were supportive, encouraging and, most of all, understanding of the pain and distress military PTSD creates for the individual under treatment and their families.  I would strongly urge any fellow ex-servicemen or ex-servicewomen who may have issues arising from their service to consider using the excellent service provided by IAPT.

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust o

title: Patience is a virtue
body: Every one I've meet in audiology over the last year has been brilliant, now have hearing aids new lease of life. Well worth the wait many thanks to all.

title: Superb
body: From the minute I walked through the door to leaving the clinic I received the most amazing standard of care. I was treated with the utmost care, respect and kindness by every member of staff. Cataract procedures may be routine for the NHS staff but there was a full appreciation of how traumatic it is for the patient. Thanks to everyone for supporting me throughout the procedure.

title: MIU
body: First time having to go to the minor injuries unit. Seen very quickly by the triage nurse and then a lovely ENP who quickly sorted out my injury. Very happy I went to Ripley instead of my more local department which would have been Derby A&E and would recommend them to anyone with a similar problem. Thanks a lot!

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great nurse
body: I had appt for smear test I was very nervous I had a very bad experience last time so I been avoiding it to get my smear test done but has soon as I entered the room I told the nurse I’m very nervous straight away she was extremely very understanding and she took my smear didn’t rush me told me to take as long as I want was talking to me while taking my smear so she can divert my mind Amazing nurse. Thank you so much.

title: Amazing
body: I had never been to the Hospital before , on entering i was approached by a volunteer who took my Mom, My Husband  and myself to where we had to go , he was very lovely and chatted along the way , at the reception of Gastroenterology department the lady was just as nice and the man who took me from there was fun and made us all laugh , i had a team that took care of me and the procedure was over 7 hours , i was looked after so well and did not feel scared , i was on Gas, Air and sedation so was fully aware of what was happening ,  these people are just all very lovely , caring and Amazing , i cant name people but would love to , my Mom and my Husband were in the hospital for over 10 hours and said they were treated the best in that department , always informed , they had breakfast and lunch in the hospital , i ended up in there over night and was very grateful for my care from beginning to end , i am happy to write the best review for this hospital and the Gastroenterology department

title: Needs improvement  9
body: I had gone to collect prescription but after much searching you couldn't find it so you reprinted it. That was the third time in a month that had happened

title: Practice under pressure but showing signs of…
body: Since January the practice has changed its arrangements for seeing patients with some success and its now possible to see the same doctor for most appointments which can be very helpful. They are working hard to improve their services and the results are showing through. The hardworking medical staff are caring and trying hard to meet patient needs but they would be the first to admit that there are still areas for further improvement

title: Poor Practice
body:
When you ring to get an appointment to see the doctor.
You speak to him on the phone he tells you to come in for appointment when you arrive you find he has made an appointment with the surgery nurse who can’t prescribe can’t make referrals so the visit was none eventful and did not achieve anything at all. Telling me she will have to ask the doctor and get back to me this evening which never happened so I will have to ring the surgery tomorrow to try and find the outcome of my visit.
The system is not working because when you need to see a GP a nurse who cannot help will not do.
I do believe theGP should inform you if he has made the appointment with someone other than a GP

title: Excellent service
body: I recently underwent a rigid Cystoscopy at West Cornwall hospital Surgical unit following bladder cancer and can honestly say I was most impressed by the whole team. The staff were absolutely incredible from the very outset being friendly, caring, cheerful and excellent in every aspect of their work. I was the last patient left on the unit and they really did go the extra mile in delivering a service second to none despite it being very late in the day when I was fit to go home. The ward itself was scrupulously clean and tidy, the theatres incredibly well maintained and the treatment afforded to me second to none! Thank you all so much for your excellent care, you should be justly proud of the service you offer and I would like to say what a credit you all are to your profession. Your tireless efforts make our NHS the envy of the world and something we should all be truly grateful to have.

title: This hospital should be closed
body: This is the worst hospital I have every been. For them you are nobody, it doesn't matter how serious your pain is, it doesn't matter your condition. They only care if you're dying, maybe not even then. No human rights, no respect, no nothing!!! Why am I paying taxes? The UK medical system is the worst I've ever seen. Nobody should pay for this. They keep sending me to the GP, the GP sends me to A&E. Useless medical system! 2nd time I am going there to be seen by a dr who has absolutely no idea what to do. She kept asking me the same questions again and again. She was forgetting my answers 5 mins after. What kind of doctors are you hiring? No tests, nothing. The answer to my questions was simple, "I DON'T KNOW". She had no idea about my problem. How can a doctor say that? If I knew how to solve my problem at home I would have never come to a hospital. Shame on you!

readBy.name: Basildon and Thurrock University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Attentive and caring
body:
Self presented after an accident at home, the triage nurse (Emma) was lovely and very reassuring. I was then seen within about an hour by a lovely ANP (can't remember her name unfortunately) who assessed me and reassured me, giving me clear advice and even listening to me when talking about my other unrelated health issues. Both nurses spoke to me with kindness and i felt very comfortable in their care.
My only slight issue was while waiting i was in quite a bit of pain, so i went to the receptionist to ask if it was possible to get any paracetamol, and she directed me to the nurses desk, but unfortunately it wasn't manned. However i understand that this request was outside of the receptionists remit and the poor triage nurses looked like they were run ragged, so i wasn't unhappy with this! Also i was seen pretty quickly after that so it wasn't a problem at all. Your staff do a great job with the pressures they are put under, and were really caring towards me and my relatively minor injury - your staff are a credit to your department. Thank you ever so much all.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

title: Terrible service
body: My doctor referred me to a specialist at Southmead, apparently a leading consultant in his field. Firstly after weeks and weeks of waiting I chased up the referral only to be told firstly it was on a waiting list, followed several weeks later by it wasn't there. This took approximately 10 phonecalls to 10 different people to establish. One of them even hung up on me! This was only resolved when my own GP got involved. After that the appointment came through quite quick. Me and my husband took a day off work to attend. We left home early in the morning and sat in traffic for two hours to get there. Only for the appointment to last 5 minutes!! I didnt see the expected specialist I saw his registrar, fair enough. Only he had no notes and didn't know why I was there. He then didn't have a copy of my MRI scan which took place several months before. He told me there was nothing he could do without looking at this and would obtain it and call me the next day. This was weeks ago and i have received no such call. I have a Condition that is intensified by stress. The whole situation of chasing the appointment caused a flair up so I have not bothered chasing them again to date.
